chapter.title: Pious People of the World
chapter.subtitle: חסדי עמות העלם - Chasidei Umot haOlam
chapter.para: Chassidei Umot haOlam are not attached to bnei Yisrael like gerim. They are still attached to their host nation and are held hostage in a way(see Rebbe's Sichot on this matter). They would of been with klal Yisrael during maten Torah but their host nations held them hostage. Spiritually, they are attached to klal Yisrael, but not physically and do not gain those blessings. Those who are physically attached by living among bnei Yisrael are referred to as ger toshav. Their host nations receive blessings from them.
Chassidei Umot haOlam may give a burnt offering.

Chassidei Umot haOlam have animal souls that emanate from klipat nogah. Klipot nogah contains a mixture of good and evil and is the same place where bnei Yisrael animal souls and clean animal souls originate.

sect1.title: History
sect1.para: Pious means: use note text from R'Turen

It says that Avraham has kept all of haShem's mitzvot and Torot. An opinion says that Avraham kept the sheva mitzvot bnei Noach and brit milah. Another opinion says that he kept both the Torah sheba'alpeh and Torah shebikhtav. It appears to me that both opinions are correct and do not contradict. How could Avraham have kept mitzvot that were yet to be commanded? He did them through the Torah of Shem v'Ever. Avraham was the first ger tzedek. Yoma 28a?

sect1.title: Halacha
sect1.para: Chassidei umot haOlam are the same as keepers of the seven laws of bnei Noach, except they keep the seven laws because haShem gave them via Moshe and Torah. There is a disagreement if it's because the seven are in Torah or if it's because Moshe received and gave them again.
